content.question: Which of the following was the most direct political consequence of Japan’s attempts to sustain the economic trend shown in the table for the period 1930–1938 ?

choices.label: Japan expanded the voting franchise to the middle class and women.
Japan engaged in imperial expansion to acquire access to raw materials.
Japan passed a constitution that limited the authority of the emperor and thereby increased the power of commercial interests in parliament.
Japan supported League of Nations resolutions that called upon Western powers to grant independence to their colonies.

content.answer: Japan engaged in imperial expansion to acquire access to raw materials.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
